Text: It's quiet—not a soul in sight.

No birds, not even insects. What if there isn't even
a blade of grass left standing?
We should investigate more closely.
Agreed. Stay alert and keep close.
I make my decision after observing the silent village.
...Hmm.

We come across a large, partially destroyed house.
Could this be the work of the possessed?
Let's check inside.

With those words, Zeta casually steps into what
remains of the house.
B-Be a little more careful...
Don't worry. I'm not picking up on anything.

Zeta primarily conducts undercover operations and has
a keen eye for potential threats. I'll take her word for it
if she says the coast is clear.
...There really is nothing here.

Indeed, there's nothing at all—only the remains of
what was once a person.

This place is in shambles, and someone's made off
with all the food and valuables.
Yes, and there are signs of a struggle.

The walls are marked as well. Looks like the villager
tried to put up a fight before being killed.

Beta whispers this grimly as she gazes down at the
knife clutched in the corpse's hand.

Signs of a struggle, missing food and valuables...
This could be a good learning opportunity for Beta.
What's your take on this situation, Beta?
...Something doesn't add up.

Beta asserts this firmly after her eyes sweep the
room to confirm her assessment.
How so?

If the possessed did decimate this village, no houses
would be left standing like this.

There's no such thing as a magical overload that
conveniently kills off villagers but leaves houses
intact.

I agree. The frenzy of being intoxicated by magic is
not something you can control.

Yeah. The last thing you're worrying about is your
surroundings.

Our expressions cloud as we recall the onset of
possession.

All of us—Beta, Zeta, and myself—know firsthand how
painful the symptoms are.

It also doesn't add up that there are signs of a
struggle. It should be a clear-cut victory either
way...

You're right. Either the villagers would form a mob
and tyrannize the possessed, or the possessed would
lay waste to the villagers...

One way or another, the results would be one-sided.
There's almost no situation where their forces would
be closely matched.
Yes, I see it the same way as both of you.

I hadn't expected any less from Zeta, but I'm
impressed with Beta's ability to observe her
surroundings.

She may even be more observant than Zeta—
Such thoughts silently cross my mind.
So what exactly took place here? Thoughts, Beta?

Encouraged, Beta continues to speak without stopping
to catch her breath.

This is most likely the work of a band of thieves or
rogues of a similar sort.
Based on what?
The missing food and valuables.

To hypothesize...a band of thieves claiming to be the
possessed attacked this village to plunder food and
gold.

The villagers fought back with sickles and knives but
were outmatched, and the thieves ultimately succeeded
in their pillaging.

Indeed, that gives us a clearer picture. And besides
the valuables and food, there's something else
missing here.
Something else?

Beta cocks her head to the side as if the thought
hadn't occurred to her.
A young girl's corpse.
Ack, that's right!

Beta grasps the meaning of my words, and her face
darkens.
Those absolute scum.

Zeta turns her gaze in a different direction and
spits, almost as if she sees someone there.
Well played.
From the direction of her gaze, a voice answers.
